name: recompensing
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
present participle of
recompense
to give something to someone as a payment or reward for their efforts or loss: The court awarded the women $100,000 each to recompense them for nine years of lost wages. The company says it has no legal or moral responsibility to assist in recompensing customers.
More examplesFewer examplesThe government refused to act to recompense the innocent victim.Not all breaches of contract can be recompensed adequately by money.If the Government wishes to recompense the consumer, then the taxpayer should pay.
